alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 21 at 5:13AM PST until January 21 at 1:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON ABOVE 6500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 6500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches at elevations between 6500 and 7000 feet, 2 to 6 inches between 7000 and 8000 feet, and greater than 6 inches above 8000 feet. * WHERE...San Bernardino County Mountains. * WHEN...Until 1 PM Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Mountain passes above 7,000 feet will have the best chance to see accumulating snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will rise on Sunday afternoon above 7,000 feet. Snow levels above 7,000 feet will remain on Monday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For road condition information in California...enter 8 0 0 4 2 7 7 6 2 3 if inside california or 9 1 6 4 5 5 7 6 2 3 if outside California.
